name: Stumble Inn Backpackers Lodge Stellenbosch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cheap backpacker joint. Staff are friendly, but rooms leave quite a bit to be desired. They didn't feel all that secure either. The staff and some guests also decided to have a party when we were there and played some thumping techo till the early hours, the noise from which easily travelled through the thin walls to our room. I reckon if you're an 18 yr old traveller on a tight budget then this would be an acceptable (and maybe even fun?) place to stay. For us it was a bit below par.
reviews.title: No frills place. Might be ok if you're under 20 years old

reviews.text: During our backpacking trip through Capetown, we decided to check out the wineries at Stellenbosch and came across Stumble Inn.
reviews.title: Don't stay here, you'll FREEZE

reviews.text: We arrived in the Spring and Capetown was still a bit on the chilly side. There was no heater in the rooms and the rooms were freezing. In addition, the bathrooms often ran out of hot water so taking a shower was difficult at best.
reviews.title: Fun; Good location

reviews.text: Also, noise traveled easily between the rooms. During our stay, there was probably 20 kids (age 10) who stayed there for a sports tournament and they were LOUD morning through night.
reviews.title: Cozy hostel in a very dutch town!

aka: Stumble Inn Backpackers Lodge Stellenbosch Hotel Stellenbosch
description: Centrally located, genuine old style backpackers lodge, dorms and doubles, swimming pool and pool table, gr8 wine tours, bike hire, self catering kitchens, free tea and coffee.
